contentList.content: You never could use magic in the way others do. But you learned the occult way to perform rituals to extract the essence of other beings who could and use it to channel magic with and through it.
Instead of Spellslots, the Ritualist uses Essence from Beings and store it to call their powers.
This Summon is an Conduit for your Arcane Blast.
Summon an Incarnate. This Creature is bound to you and serves as your source of power. You can choose the Form of your Incarnate.
Summon an Bound Mephit. The Summon is stationary and cant be controlled. Lasts for 3 Turns.
Make an active Summon or Familiar your Incarnate. Has to be recast after long Rest.
You spend 1 Essence Points to cast the next Ritual Blast, Ritual Strike or Bound Mephit Summon as a Bonus Action
You spend 2 Essence Points to split your next Ritual Blast, Ritual Strike into 3 or to summon 3 Bound Mephits.
You spend 1 Essence Point to cast the next Ritual Blast, Ritual Strike or Bound Mephit Summon silently. They do not break stealth.
You spend 2 Essence Points to change the next Blast to have Effect on an Area
You spend 1 Essence Points to charge up your Summons, giving them an additional Action. If you attack an Enemy with Ritual Strike, you charge yourself to recieve an addition Bonusaction.
Your Blast leaps from your Summon to a foe dealing 1d10 Force damage. Ritual Strike becomes an ranged Attack and costs 1 Essence Point.

You spend 1 Essence Point to have your next Blast command your Summon to defend and counter attacks aimed at them. Movement is halved. If you attack an Enemy with Ritual Strike, you recieve the effect.
Try to parry and counter attacks aimed at you. Movement is halved.
You spend 1 Essence Point to add your Spellcastingmodifier to the next Attack of the affected Summon. If you attack an Enemy with Ritual Strike your next attack deals additional 2 Damage.
The next Attack deals additional Damage.
Use your Summons as a conduit. You can Buff, Heal or even Attack through them, depending on used Augmentations.
Perform a bloody Ritual to fill your chosen weapon with Essence. Needs a corpse as target.
Your Ritualweapon unlocks your abilities to manipulate and store Essence.
Attack your foe with your Essence charged Weapon. Augments work with this Attack.
Perform a Ritual of Blood and harvest the Essence of a corpse. Restores one Essence Point (only active if under 4 Essence Points).

Infuse your Incarnate with the Aspect of a powerful Being from another Plane. You perform a rite to bind a parasitic connection from one of those beings to your Aspect and your Aspect with you, imbue the both of you with powerful magic.
The Angel grants the heavenly Power to protect the weak.
The aspect of the Angle flows through you. Your Summons are protected by additional 5 Healthpoints each turn.
Provides an Aura with protective Boons to Allies in a 6m radius around you. As you grow stronger, more Boons are added.
You get a Bonus to your Saving Throws equal to the Wisdommodifierer of the Ritualst.
You gain 1d4 Radiant Damage Bonus and 1d4 Roll Bonus.
While in Combat you get healed by 1d8+Wisdommodifierer of the Ritualst.
The Bheur Hag grants the Power to control the Battlefield in an icy grip
Spellcasts cause the ground to freeze
The aspect of the Bheur Hag flows through you. Your Ice Mephit causes the ground to freeze on its attacks.
Shatter the frozen Ground in an icy Explosion
The victim is vulnerable to cold and bludgeoning attacks. The frosty rime on its skin slows it down and blocks reactions and extra Attacks.
You are vulnerable to cold and bludgeoning attacks, reactions and extra attacks are blocked and you take 2d4 cold damage each turn.
Teleport to a chosen Icy surface.
Shatter the frozen Ground in 3 icy Explosions
The Fey grants you Power over the Wisps to play with the minds of your victims.
The aspect of the Fey flows through you. Your Mephits change their attackspell depending on the Wisp they are near.
The dissonant Whispers of this wip try to frighten enemies. Your Incarnate and Mephits in proximity unlock the dissonant Whispers Spell.
Tries to frighten Enemies each turn. Incarnates and Mephits unlock the dissonant Whispers Spell
Dissonant Whispers haunt you and try to frighten you.
This Wisp tries to cause madness in the mindes of its victims. Your Incarnate and Mephits in proximity unlock the phantasmal Force Spell.
Tries to madden Enemies each turn. Incarnates and Mephits unlock the phantasmal Force Spell
Something tries to drive you into madness.
This Wisp tries to cause hypnotize its victims. Your Incarnate and Mephits in proximity deal more damage to hypnotized enemies.
Tries to hypnotize Enemies each turn. Incarnates and Mephits deal more damage to hypnotized enemies.
Something very mesmerising whispers to me.
Conjure a Swarm of Flumphs that explode on the end of the turn. Deals double damage to enemies suffering under a wisp. Gives Essence to Summons in proximity of the explosion.

Haunt a creature with illusions of its greatest fears. It takes 3d10Damage Psychic Damage per turn, cannot move, has Disadvantage on Ability Checks and Attack Rolls. Deals extra damage for every distinct Effect of a Wisp.
The Demon gifts you with the eternal Rage of the Abyss
The aspect of the Demon flows through you. Your Mephits ca cast Flamestrike while you are raging.

Grant an ally demonic Rage. Your Ally can't be controlled during the rage, but can still uses casts and heavy armour. As long as the rage is active, the raging ally can be used as a target for your Ritual Bolt/Strike. When the Rage ends, your ally is left exhausted for two turns.

Try to inflict burning Rage to your enemy. They enter a Frenzy, maybe droping their weapon to shred you bare handed. While Raging they are cunsumed by flames and lose their finesse in fighting, causing them to have a -1d4 on attackrolls.
The burning Rage consumes you. Suffer from burning and -1d4 on attackrolls.

Give in to your demonic Aspect. You enter the Demonrage, growing Claws, become faster, sturdier, get an additional Attack and cast Flamestrike as Bonusaction. Failing to deal damage in a round ends the Rage and leave you Exhausted for 2 Turns.
You have grown Claws, are faster, sturdier, can attack twice a turn and you can cast Flamestrike as Bonusaction. Failing to deal damage in a round ends the Rage and leave you Exhausted for 2 Turns.
Hit your Target with a pair of Demonclaws.

Give in to your demonic Aspect. You enter the greater Demonrage, growing burning Claws, become much faster, sturdier, get two additional Attacks and cast Flamestrike as Bonusaction. Failing to deal damage in a round ends the Rage and leave you Exhausted for 2 Turns.

You have grown strong Claws that cause burning, are much faster, sturdier, can attack three times a turn and you can cast Flamestrike as Bonusaction. Failing to deal damage in a round ends the Rage and leave you Exhausted for 2 Turns.
The Lich grants your Incarnate the Power of Corruption and you the Power of the Unliving
Spellcasts cause crawling gnawl on the victim they hit. If the victim dies, it turns into a Zombie.
The aspect of the Lich flows through you. Your Summons cause Festering Wounds on their attacks.
Make your Summon a Cursebringer. The next Attack of that Summons will inflict the chosen curse to the victim.
The victims has -1d4 to it attack rolls and receives a bleeding cut an every attack
CURSED! Your attack rolls are reduced by -1d4 and you cut yourself an every attack.
The next Attack applies the Curse of Selfharming to your foe.
The victims has -1 on Spellrolls and gets dazed after he casts a Spell
CURSED! Your Spellrolls are reduced by 1 and you daze yourself when casting.
The next Attack applies the Curse of Spellfail to your foe.
Deal necrotic damage to your victim and causes a festering wound.
Deals 2 Necrotic Damage each turn and additional 2 Necrotic Damage for each curse, poison or plague the victim suffers from.
Summon an undead Clawed Hand that deals 1d4 damage and can infect its victims. Very handy!
This undead Clawed Hand attacks your foes and can infect its victims. Very handy!
Deals 2 Necrotic Damage each turn and additional 2 Necrotic Damage for each curse, poison or plague the victim suffers from.
Cause a corpse to explode and inflict festering wounds to all targets in the area.
The Shadowfell grants your Incarnate the Power to walk in the Shadows and you alike.
The aspect of the Shadow flows through you. Your Mephits are invisible the first round and deal extra damage, when attacking out of Invisibility.
Your Aspects grew stronger, they grant you and your Incarnate additional boons. Mephits cause Statuseffects depending on their element.
Your Aspects grew stronger, they grant you and your Incarnate additional boons.
Evolutions enhance your Incarnate by providing useful additions.
Small Evolutions that enhance your Incarnate in a minor manner.
Removes all Evolutions from your Incarnate and restores your Evolution Points.
Adds Psychic Damage to your Melee Attacks.
Adds Force Damage to your Melee Attacks.
Adds 1d4 Damage (Poison) to your Melee Attacks.
Adds a Bite Attack to your Incarnate as a Bonus Action.
The Incarnates Scent becomes quite acute. It can detect invisible Beings and hidden things.
The Legs of your Incarnate become stronger and enables it to pounce at your foes.
Medium Evolutions that enhance your Incarnate.
Your Incarnate gets a skin that let him melt into its surroundings grant him invisibility at will.
The Skin becomes much more resistant against the Elements and Spells.
The Skin becomes resistant to physical attacks.
Your Incarnate gets the instinct to aid his Pack. Unlocks the "Help"-Ability and a Healing Spell.
The Incarnates is enabled to dish out heavy strikes, that leave its victim exhausted.
You are exhausted. Your Rolls and your Damage is reduced by 2.
Legendary Evolutions that enhance your Incarnate.
Your Incarnate becomes huge and it are enhanced to mirror its size. Bonis: +4 Strength and Constitution, advantage on strengthrolls, Bonusdamage, +2 Size.
Your Incarnate becomes an frightful display. Everyone in 3m proximity must role a Wisdomsave or become mortified.
You frightened to death. You feel weak, your strength based attacks deal half damage, you cant move and all ability or attack rolls are on disadvantage.

Your Incarnate becomes a born hunter. He moves faster and when he attacks an enemy in melee combat, he marks his target. The marked target suffers additional 1d6 damage from all incoming attacks. Bonis: +4 Dexterity, ignores difficult terrain, +3m movement.
Your Incarnate grows glands in his mouth that produces poison to spit.
Your Incarnate gets nimble fingers perfectly fit to open all kind of locks.
Your Incarnate goes through the process of evolution! Just. a. Moment.
Your Incarnate learns how to channel an variation of Ritual Blast on their own.
Channel an Ritual Blast and shoot it towards your Enemy.

Your Incarnate becomes a potent Spellcaster. He gets a bonus of 4 Intelligence and Wisdom. All Spellrolls are increased by 1. Spells get half the Spellcastingabilitymodifier of the Summoner as Bonusdamage.
Bonus of 4 to Intelligence and Wisdom. Spellrolls and DC is increased by 1. Spells deal additional damage equal to hald the summoners Spellcastingabilitymodifier.
Your Incarnate is a Smart Ass. He can give you or your allies advice, which grants a Bonus to Rolls equal his Intelligencemodifier in Conversations (stacks with Guidance).
You know it best. You give the smarted advice to your Owner. Always. You can rise the Rolls in Conversation equal to your Intelligencemodifier.
The Incarnate grows scales that grants him an additional AC 2.
The Incarnate gets stronger. Meleeattacks do more damage equal to the Proficiency Bonus of the Ritualist.
The Claws of your Incarnate are more likely to do a critical Hit
Your Incarnate becomes a living Bullwark, that can take a lot of punch and protect everyone around it. Bonus: +4 Constitution, +2 AC, +20% HP, -3 damage recieved, -3m Movement.
Build up a 3m wide area around you, that halfs the damage allies take and boosts their AC and Savingthrows by 2. You can't move while shielding.
You take only half damage and your AC and Savingthrows are increased by 2
The Body is strenghend but the mind is weakened. +2 Strength, Dexterity and Constitution. -1 to Intelligence, Wisdom and Charisma.
The Mind is strenghend but the body is weakened. +2 Intelligence, Wisdom and Charisma. -1 to Strength, Dexterity and Constitution.
